research_areas.description: Focuses on developing advanced theory, algorithms, and codes to explain various properties of materials (crystal structure, magnetism, transport) in both 3D bulk materials and low-dimensional systems (graphene, nanotubes, clusters). Utilizes theoretical modeling and first-principles calculations based on Density Functional Theory.

Research focuses on a variety of material systems, including magnetic materials (ferrites, oxide/nitride semiconductors, organic semiconductors), metallic compounds, multilayer thin films, Heuslar alloys, spin chain compounds, intermetallics,  artificial diamond films, and graphene-based sensors and chemical filters.

ongoing_projects.name: Growth of Magnetic Materials
ongoing_projects.description: Using Pulsed Laser Deposition (PLD), Chemical Vapor Deposition (CVD), and Langmuir Blodgett systems to grow ferrites, oxide/nitride semiconductors, and organic semiconductors.

ongoing_projects.name: High Pressure High Temperature Synthesis
ongoing_projects.description: Producing metallic compounds with uncommon metal ion oxidation states.

ongoing_projects.name: Spintronic Applications of Heuslar Alloys and Multilayer Thin Films
ongoing_projects.description: Investigating spin and electronic structure correlations in Heuslar alloys and multilayer thin films for spintronic applications.

ongoing_projects.name: Spin Interactions and Phases in Spin Chain Compounds and Intermetallics
ongoing_projects.description: Studying spin glass and spin liquid behavior in spin chain compounds and intermetallics using solid-state NMR to understand fundamental spin-spin interactions.

ongoing_projects.name: Artificial Diamond Films for Radiation-Hard Detectors
ongoing_projects.description: Developing artificial diamond films using Microwave Plasma CVD for high-energy particle detector applications.

ongoing_projects.name: Graphene-based Sensors and Chemical Filters
ongoing_projects.description: Developing sensors and chemical filters based on graphene nanomaterials.

additional_details.facilities: PLD/CVD, Langmuir Blodgett systems, High Pressure High Temperature furnace, Solid State NMR, Microwave Plasma CVD, AFM, High resolution X-ray diffraction, Surface chemical Analyser (ESCA), Class 10,000 cleanroom with photolithography, rapid thermal annealing, chip scribing, and ultrasonic wire bonding, Cryogenic facility with liquid Helium, Magneto-transport and SQUID magnetometry down to 300 mK.

research.research_area: Soft Matter, Biophysics, and Nonlinear Dynamics
research.description: Research in this area spans theoretical and experimental investigations of soft matter (polymers, granular matter, driven poly-crystals), biological physics (active matter, gene regulation, epigenetics, cellular dynamics, mechanics of cell division, shape transformations), and nonlinear dynamics (electrical circuits, electrochemical systems, stochastic delay differential equations).  The work builds upon the foundations of statistical mechanics and extends to non-equilibrium processes and nonlinear phenomena.

research_areas.description: Explores light-matter interactions in various physical systems to understand fundamental concepts and develop novel technologies. Focuses on nonlinear optics, ultrafast phenomena, molecular spectroscopy, nano-optics and plasmonics, organic LEDs and devices.
